Class GUID

java.lang.Object
  pgrid.util.guid.GUID
      pgrid.GUID
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable, GUID
public class GUID
extends GUID
implements GUID

This class stores unique IDs and provides some basic access methods.

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Roman Schmidt

Field Detail

mGUIDs

protected static WeakHashMap mGUIDs
The list of already created GUIDs. A weak hash map is use to lower the memory usage of P-Grid. The idea is as long as we have a living reference of the GUID we will have a cache for it. This will speed up the creation of GUID used by hosts. The cache system don't keep a reference to non permanent objects.

Constructor Detail

GUID

public GUID()
Construct a new GUID. This constructor should only be used to create GUIDs, which were never used by other objects again.

GUID

public GUID(String v)
Constructs an unique ID object from the given string. This constructor should only be used to create GUIDs, which were never used by other objects again.

Parameters:
v - a string representing a GUID

toString

public String toString()
Returns a unique string representation of this unique ID. The byte array that represents the unique ID is stepped through byte per byte and each byte is converted into its hex representation (padded with leading zeros).

Specified by:
toString in interface GUID
Overrides:
toString in class GUID
Returns:
the unique string representation of the unique ID.

equals

public boolean equals(GUID obj)
Compares two unique IDs for equality. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a GUID object that represents the same unique id as this object.

Parameters:
obj - the object to compare with.
Returns:
true if the objects are the same; false otherwise.
